intro: Navarretia linearifolia, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing delicate flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Navarretia linearifolia is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid environments.
